description: Erection of a two storey house with waste storage and associated works following the demolition of existing side extension.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Design and Access Statement, Energy Statement, Fire Statement, Unnumbered existing block plan, Unnumbered location plan Received on 20/12/2021; A101 REV A and A102 REV A Received on 19/05/2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby approved shall match those used in the existing building at 7 Gould Road.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - The ground floor bathroom formed in the side elevation and first floor bathroom window formed in the front elevation as shown on drawing number A102 REV A, of the hereby approved development shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved development or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the approved development evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 9 - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:

"	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
"	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
"	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, the site shall be subdivided and the boundary treatment erected along the front, side and rear of the development as shown on the site plan drawing numbered A101 REV A. The boundary treatment shall thereafter be maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, details of hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained in accordance with such thereafter. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 12 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved full details (including manufacturers specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 2 bicycles) for the occupants of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
The approved facilities shall be fully implemented prior to occupation and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 13 - Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved development the waste and recycling store shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development.

Condition : 14 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access along the full length of the site boundary on Gould Road shall be permanently closed and the kerbs and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement, and the footway parking markings shall be extended along the frontage of the site.
